content: ffrreeee ppaatttteerrnn ee ll ll aa kk nn cc oo ii ii pp tt oo tt mm rr ee oo pp pp uu slip_stitch supplies supplies yarn 6 super bulky bernat blanket in green about 1 oz hook l/8mm hook tools & notions yarn needle scissors stitch markers other materials poly-fil stuffing 2 black 10mm safety eyes black embroidery thread abbreviations abbreviations uu slip_stitch ccrroocchheett tteerrmmiinnoollooggyy magic_ring magic_ring st s stitch s slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet bobble bobble decrease increase increase decrease decrease stitches are worked in the round round instead of row number of stitches at the end of each round notes notes use the invisible decrease method for decreases special x2 bobble stitch yo insert hook into st pull up a loop yo pull through 2 loops on hook repeat one more time yo and pull through all 3 loops on the hook decrease pop them out as you go slip stitches should be made looser replace them all with single_crochet for a straight pickle secure your magic_ring with a knot on the inside place eyes between rnds 3 and 4 three stitches apart with the group of slsts facing the right emboider a v shaped mouth over round 5 across 2 sts and between the eyes begin make a magic_ring magic_ring round 1 single_crochet x7 into the magic_ring and close 7 round 2 increase x7 14 round 3 single_crochet x14 14 secure magic_ring round 4 single_crochet 2 bobble single_crochet 11 14 round 5 single_crochet 7 bobble single_crochet 6 14 round 6 single_crochet 12 bobble single_crochet 1 14 round 7+8 slip_stitch 7 single_crochet 7 14 place eyes and mouth begin stuffing round 9 single_crochet 6 bobble single_crochet 7 14 round 10 single_crochet x14 14 round 11 single_crochet 10 bobble single_crochet 3 14 round 12+13 slip_stitch 7 single_crochet 7 14 round 14 single_crochet 2 bobble single_crochet 11 14 round 15 single_crochet 12 bobble single_crochet 1 14 round 16 single_crochet 8 bobble single_crochet 5 14 round 17 single_crochet x14 14 round 18 decrease x7 7 finish fasten_off stuff firmly weave yarn needle through front loops of the last 7 sts and pull close weave in ends use worsted weight yarn and
